intro: Vicia japonica f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Japanese vetch, is a cultivar of the common vetch species. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers, which contrast with its green foliage. The plant is a herbaceous annual or biennial, typically growing to a height of about 30–60 cm. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate, showy blooms and its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
